item.title: Angela add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Angela add a quote by Mircea Eliade
item.description: "to have solely one thought, but it to be capable to destroy the universe." -- Mircea Eliade

item.title: Angela add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "No man remains quite what he was when he recognizes himself." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Angela add a quote by Salvador Dalí
item.description: "Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings." -- Salvador Dalí

item.title: Angela add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Angela add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Angela add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The past is never dead. It's not even past." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Angela add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Angela add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Angela add a quote by David Lodge
item.description: "Literature is mostly about having sex and not much about having children; life's the other way round." -- David Lodge

item.title: Angela add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West
